Chapter 3 - Diagonosis and Prognosis


Aimi came to and blinked to clear her vision.
The overhead fluorescent lights were dazzling.
Lights? She shivered again, and rubbed at

Aimi’s eyes snapped open.
She looked at her hand, then at her surroundings.
She was in a small, white-painted room
decorated with glass-door cabinets
and anatomical charts and pictures.
A thin white sheet was pulled over her.
She peered under the sheet and found
she was only dressed in a thin hospital gown.



"You’re awake," a voice said. She looked toward the voice and saw a man looking around the door frame.


"Hey, doc," he called. "She’s awake."

Aimi felt her throat.
Her memory was a blur but she remembered

before she passed out and that something

quite recall all the details.


Then a realization hit her as a woman

"I’m Doctor Sparago," she began.

Can you tell me your name?”


“I-I umm I’m not sure”

“Do you know your age or
remember anything at all”





“Umm I’m not sure. I think I’m 14 and
I vaguely remember choking and
being in pain then waking up here”



“As we feared. You have a mild concussion
but you also seem to have amnesia”


“Do you hurt still anywhere?”


“Yeah my head”

Aimi stared at her bare feet, visible

they looked different somehow.

off and different about her body.



"May I come in?"
Lisa looked up a man no a teenager walk
into the room to the foot of her bed.



"You look better than the first time I saw you," he said.



Aimi wasn’t sure why but she blushed
taking it as a compliment. She also noted
how cute and handsome he was.


“Who are you?”


She noted his features Framed by straight
dark brown hair, his face was
regular save for a nose that looked just
one size too large. His brown eyes were
warm, sharp and intelligent.
His body was slim yet build in a shapeless
plaid shirt and chinos that bore the muddy

They both blushed this time then he introduced
himself.
“I’m Michael. Michael Gail. Sorry that we aren’t
meeting under better circumstances”




“Anyway darling I’m afraid to say you were in a
terrible traffic accident”


He moved to shake her hand.
Aimi didn’t pull her hand out of his grasp.
His hands were large and warm,
like his eyes.
She found herself momentarily
forgetting the frightening experience
she had—how long ago was it? Or her current one.



She didn’t wanna admit it but there was something
about him even tho they had just met.


"What time is it?" she asked.




"It’s just after nine," Michael answered.
His voice was deep and musical.
She blinked and smiled again.


"Thank you for helping me," she said.
Michael nodded.


"You’re welcome. It’s not every day I get a
chance to help a pretty girl on the road."


Aimi looked at his hand holding hers,
then up at his face. His features were
handsome, his expression open and honest.
He was very attractive, she thought.


What was she thinking. He’s older, they just met
and despite that Baka’s compliment she knew

She had a tomboyish streak!
She had a somewhat flat chest!
She had a few intact memories of things

Aimi. realized her clothes and belongings

Aimi reached out and turned on
the nightstand light once more,
then straightened and looked at Michael.
He smiled as he admired her cute petite form.


"Now, stand here next to me," she said.


"Okay," Michael replied, a touch of
humor in his voice as he stood erect
and began to walk around the bed towards her.
His smile faded slightly and the
puzzled look returned to his face.
He noticed where Aimi’s Head was.



“Michael how tall are you?"


"Six feet,Three" he replied.


“Aimi, you do look a little different--"


"I’m growing, Michael . My body is growing
bigger with every moment that passes."


“Well of course you’re growing you are
You’re a teenager after”


“No you don’t get it Michael listen and think
and look hard.
Remember I told that the puberty fairy
practically sees me as a no fly zone.
Remember I told you that I’m 4 Foot 5 normally
Remember that I told you I’ve barely grown an
inch since I was 8.”


Michael had mixed feelings where this was
going.
Michael looked here up and down.
It was starting to dawn on him.


“ I’m--I’m scared. I don’t understand what’s
happening to me. On one hand I like it but... Oh!"


Michael grasped Aimi’s arms as she
suffered another dizzy spell.
She closed her eyes and cursed with
the effort to shake it off.


“I think I just had another growth spurt,"
she said. She gripped his arms to steady
herself. "I keep having these attacks of vertigo.
They started when I was at the hospital.”



Michael eyed the cutie he was falling for.


“I think that every time I feel dizzy my
body is spurting up." Her eyes misted over.

“Oh, God, Michael , what am I going to do?
I’m scared it’s never going to stop!"
Tears began to roll down Aimi’s cheeks.


Michael stood before her, his face
totally blank, jaw dropped in shock.
He must be completely dumbfounded by
what she had told him.


’ God, she thought, panic rising inside
her, he doesn’t believe me.
He must think I’m some kind of crackpot.
Please, I don’t want to be alone,
I don’t want him to leave--


Michael closed his mouth with an
audible snap. The smile returned to
his face, slowly. He put his arms around
her and hugged her until she found it hard
to breathe.


“My little cutie” he whispered in her ear.
"I believe you. I don’t understand it, either,
but I know you’re telling the truth."


Aimi began to sob. Michael released
his hold on her and took up her hands.


"I thought something was funny.
After we’d made love I thought I felt
something."


There was a bit of silence...


“ As you say, you were 4 foot 5 until tonight.
Now you’re not. Well, Aimi--" He hesitated.


"I have a confession of my own to make.
Remember I also told you I liked tall girls.
There’s a reason for that too!
When I was a younger I fantasized about
making love to giant women. I haven’t
thought about my fantasies in years, but
you are bringing them back to me.
You were beautiful and cute before, but
you’re more beautiful now.
So, you’re stuck with me whether you like it or not."


There was a pause.
“If anything you’re more perfect for me now
than you were before.
If you end up super tall that’s just a bonus.
If you shrink back or stay this size that’s fine too.
I told you during our make out that
you are unequivocally the 1st girl I’ve ever
truly fallen for, the 1st girl that being with makes
me feel calm and like all is right in the world”

Aimi was speechless.

Aimi blushed again.

“Right I almost forgot my new girlfriend has

Aimi blushed

Aimi looked shocked.
“W-well I I err uhh”


“Relax I wasn’t expecting a solid answer right

Aimi looked down and realized her clothes

Michael’s eyes bug out a bit but he recovers.

“I uhh”

I do however have a suggestion to get you to

Aimi looked at Michael curious what he was

Granted my idea is to claim we were at a

Aimi was shocked.

Chapter 10: Thoughts


Aimi woke up suddenly.
She inhaled deeply, and blinked
in the darkness. A soft snoring
reassured her that Michael was still there.
She rose slowly so as not to disturb him
and padded softly out of the room, feeling
her way in the dark for the bathroom.


When her hand found the bathroom doorknob
she halted, struck by a sudden thought.
She turned to face the door.
Reaching inside, she found the light switch,
and light flooded out of the room.
Aimi choked. She was now as tall as the top
of the door. She looked down at herself
and muffled her soft cry. Her body had
expanded even more.



Aimi felt unnaturally clumsy and unsure as
she entered the room and closed the door.
Aimi left the bathroom and walked down the
hallway towards the living room,
moving slowly. Sure enough, she found
the edge of a couch in fewer steps than
she was accustomed to. She went to the windows
and pulled open the curtains.
It was just beginning to become light,
and she could see that it was still cloudy
outside. The windowpane was cold and
damp to the touch.



’ It’s still happening. I’m still
growing, and growing, and growing.
I must be seven feet tall now.
How big will I be tonight?
Tomorrow morning?
The day after?
Michael may get his fifty-foot fantasy girl
after all. God, I hope I can live up to his fantasy.
If I don’t I hope we can still get along.
What if I grow so big I hurt him?
I don’t ever want to hurt him.
Why does he have me thinking like this?
That perverted Baka!
He’s older!
I shouldn’t be thinking like this’



Another spasm of vertigo hit her.
She imagined she could almost feel the
effect this time--a strange subtle slipping
sensation under her skin, the feeling of
shifting inside her body. She covered her
breasts with her hands, pressing, weighing.
Mostly pressing and feeling her budding breasts.



’My adolescent fantasies have come to life, too.
Finally something equivalent to puberty is
happening to me Aimi Warner of all people.
It’s nice but yet part of me wants it to stop.
At this rate I fear it might not though.
It’s nice to not be short but I’m a little worried’


Aimi left the curtains open and settled
on the hotel room couch,
shaking her head as her new weight made its
springs creak.


’ Well, Michael, I really hope you do like big girls,
‘cause I think I’m becoming the
biggest girl ever.
I dunno how big I’m going to get if this
keeps up but I hope you stick with me.
I hate to admit it to even myself but these 9
days with you have been so great.
It feels right but I know there’s things
that are wrong about it.


There’s the age difference between us.
There’s this growth that’s not normal and
whatever those bad guys did to me.
I also haven’t gotten all my memories back.
I can’t shake the feeling that there’s more
about my life and someone might be looking
for me.


I also know I still have feelings for
Michael. Strong feelings and new feelings.zcv
I wonder if this is what the girly girl types
at whatever school I went to swoon about’



Meanwhile Aimi was unaware of Sasha’s
existence or that Sasha was hunting her and
the bad guys.


’What was going to happen to her now!
Would she get more memories of life as
Aimi back?
What would her new life look like as a
potential freakish amazon or even a
bonafide giant?
Could there even be a normal anymore?’

Chapter 11 : Things Start Taking A Turn



Michael woke with a start and squinted
in the dim light to see his surroundings.
He first inspected his wristwatch: it was 547 a.m.
Looking to his right, he found he was the
only occupant in the hotel suite bed.



His features tightening, Michael
flung himself erect, the bedclothes
nearly tripping him. He pulled the bedsheet
loose, wrapped it around himself and
walked swiftly to the living room.





It was lighter in the living room,
courtesy of the partially uncurtained
Windows. Aimi lay across the couch,
legs trailing off the cushions, hands
nested under her cheek. She looked
very pretty and cute asleep--a small half-smile
decorating her features, her hair partially
hiding her ear, the soft sighing of her
breathing, her bathrobe in charmingly
open disarray. Michael felt a surge in his
affection and love for her. He bent
down and gently kissed her on the lips.
Her eyelids fluttered, and he felt her smile
under his lips. He kissed her again and
her eyes opened.


"Hi," he said softly.



"Hi," she replied. She unfolded one
hand and rubbed his stubble and unruly hair.


"You look a mess," she said impishly.
Michael grinned.


"Afraid so. How did you sleep?"


Aimi sighed. "Not very well. I kept waking up…"
Her eyes snapped wide open, and Aimi rose.
As she stood upright she gasped and
covered her mouth with her hands.


"Oh, God!" she exclaimed.


Aimi had to look down to see Michael fully.
The top of his head appeared level with
her chin. She looked down at herself.


"It’s still happening," she cried.
"I’m still growing."


Aimi turned and stubbed her toe on
the leg of the endtable beside the couch.
She stumbled, hissing in pain, then picked
herself up and limped to her
bedroom, Michael following.
Aimi stopped and bent at the knees
before her mirror to view herself in the glass.
A small, frightened sound escaped her lips
as she saw her image--she had
expanded so much she almost
didn't recognize herself.



Her torso had lengthened.
Her legs were impossibly long,
as were her arms. Even her face had
changed, her jawline longer, her cheeks broader.
Her hands-- Aimi had raised them to her face--
were longer than before, less dainty.
Her breasts were still mid A cups and in
proportion to the rest of her body but she
knew at her increased size she was starting
to outclass some of her classmates.


Edna even mentioned that they were
nearing the biggest A’s she’s seen and
if it weren’t for proportions and math she’d
call em C by now.


Her hair fell thickly down her front nearly
to her nipples. She saw Michael’s image in one
corner of the mirror and turned to face him


"Michael, what am I going to do?"
she asked plaintively.


“It kept waking me up during the night.
Every time I woke up I thought my body
growing was a bad dream. Sometimes
I thought I could almost feel the changes
happening inside me. What am I going to do?"


"I don’t know, Aimi," Michael answered.
“What is happening to you is totally unique.
I-I just don’t know-- I wish I did though."



Aimi suddenly gasped and fell to her
haunches, reaching out to steady herself.
Michael nearly lost his makeshift toga
rushing to her side.


"It’s all right, I’m okay, all right," she muttered
after several deep breaths.


"God, it’s still happening.
Look, I need to get help for this."


Michael nodded, gripping her hand
and helping her to a seat on her bed.


"But, who?" he asked.


"I can only think of one person to start,"
she replied.


Dr. John Peterson sat at the kitchenette
in his home, dressed in terry
pajamas, his breakfast of toast and coffee
cooling before him as he began his usual
Sunday routine of losing himself in the
morning paper.
He was an early riser thanks in part to
his chosen
profession He was about to turn the first
page of his New York Times when
one of the two wall-mounted phones in
the kitchen rang.


Dr. John Peterson looked up.
It was the patient phone.
He let it ring the four times necessary
for the answering machine to activate.
Thirty seconds to let the message run, and then
the machine began to record.


"Doctor Peterson, I need to see you right away.”

A female voice, young and obviously
frightened, to judge from the tremulous tones.


“Doctor it’s Aimi Warner”


“Maria and Timothy’s little girl?
The girl that turned apprentice to..”


The doctor was cutoff by his wife telling
him to answer the phone.


A fine couple -- their passing years ago
was a great shame.
She knows better than to try to make an
appointment on a Sunday.

The doctor was so annoyed and still sleepy
that something had yet to click.


“Doctor, I know this is going to sound
impossible, but I-I’ve been--I was in
a traffic accident last week, and ever since
then I-I’ve been experiencing these growth
spurts. Look--"


Aimi was cutoff.
John left his stool and grabbed up the phone.


"Aimi ? it’s John Peterson”



"Oh, Doctor, thank God.
Please let me come to see you today!
It’s urgent”


“Aimi are you okay? You’ve been missing for days
and there’s been this strange car at your house
a couple times. We even took a missing
persons report out on you!
Also I assume Sasha is hunting for you”


“I dunno who you’re talking about!
I have a recovering case of amnesia!
Never mind that Call it off! Anyway these
growth spurts are more pressing”


“ What is this about ‘growth spurts’?"



"I think that when you see me you’ll understand.
Can I come to your office?"


John looked at the clock.

“How’s about 745am and I’ll let the
Police know you’ve been located”


“Good we’ll be right over.”

He pulled the receiver from his ear as the
dial tone returned.

"Dear?" John’s wife, Margaret, in nightgown
and down-at-heel slippers, padded over to
the phone..


"Who was that?"


“It was Aimi she’s no longer missing but
apparently she needs a doctor. It sounds urgent.
I’m afraid I have to go into the clinic”



Later John finished knotting his bow tie
when he heard the sound of a large car or
truck pulling into the slim macadam parking
area next to his office. He slipped into his loafers
and tweed jacket and strode to the walkway
connecting his home and office.
He turned the latch on the office door and

when we arrived on this floor are standard
policy for dealing with contagious infections.
Presumably they think that what happening to
you is infectious, and that I'm infected as well.
That's why they've let me stay with you as long as
I have--I'm right where they want me to be.
I know that's not true, but they don't.
So, there's someone on the
door to keep me here."



"What about me?" Aimi asked.


Michael motioned with his hands.
"Stand up," he said.


“Okay. I've grown into my gown again, anyway.”


Aimi sat upright in the bed, and Michael reached
across the mattress to tie the straps of her hospital
gown more loosely, as he had done twice before.


Aimi hitched up the second gown she
was using as a wraparound skirt, and stood.
Her head bumped
the ceiling, and she bent in the middle to
save her neck being broken.


"Michael," she said. He nodded.


"I'm afraid so, Aimi . They think you're too
big to be able to leave freely of your own will"


“I hate to admit they’re right.
This is insane how big I’ve grown!
I’m big as the room. Probably like 10 feet
tall at least by now”


“I'll find a way, once they clear you," he replied.


Aimi recognized a strain in his voice
despite his outward levity.


"I don't think they will let me go, Mike,"
Aimi said softly.




“I'm so damned big and it's not stopping.
I shouldn’t even be able to stand up at this
size. All my blood should have rushed into my
legs and made me pass out.
You know, it's funny, but aside from being
so big and tall I've never felt better in my life.
I feel like I could lift up a locomotive."


Michael looked concerned, then nodded.
"What's happening to you is truly remarkable, Aimi.
I just don't know if others will see it the same way."


He clapped his hands together.
"First things first, though."





"Who gave you a set of hospital keys?"
Aimi asked. She stepped across the room
to look over his shoulder.
Michael looked up at her, an impish expression
on his face.


"Charlie--but he doesn't know it, yet."


"You picked his pocket?"


Michael inclined his head.

“Yep. Did it while we were exiting the elevator.
It was easy. He was too busy staring at you."

"Michael!"


“Hey that’s what the idiot gets for ogling my
girlfriend. Anyway you’d be surprised the skills
I picked up at my early college attendance.
When I was due to attend a really boring
lecture I'd stand at the door and exchange
the contents of other people's pockets without
their noticing. Made classes a lot more interesting.
One of my best friends from childhood had a
father who was a reformed thief. Taught us both
everything he knew. By the time I was fifteen I
was criminally proficient."


"You went to college?"


“Yep. Ah hah! Like I told you one has to
be smart to be an heir to a wealthy family’s
businesses. I hate to brag but for better or worse
I was bred and raised for it”


Aimi heard the door lock click. Michael slowly
pulled the door open, peeking around
the edge of the doorframe.

"Good," he said.
"Nobody in the next room. Aimi, I'll be right
back to you. I promise."


Michael slipped through the door.
"Michael, wait! Don't…" Aimi heard him lock
it from the other side. Concerned, she listened
intently for sounds that would
indicate Michael’s transgression had been
detected, but heard only silence.
She squatted to ease her bent back,
then stretched her arms. It felt good to move
her body freely. A sudden looseness in the
middle of her gown told her that the tieback
keeping her gown closed across her chest
and back had broken.






She looked down under each arm
then at her chest. Sure enough, the gown
was pulled forward against her small bust,
broadening the gap at her back, her breasts
pressing against the thin cotton of the gown
revealingly. She would soon need another
gown to help cover her torso.


Aimi stretched her back until her bones popped,
then each leg, hitching up her makeshift skirt to
prevent it tearing.




Aimi became increasingly nervous as time
went by. It seemed like an hour since Michael
had snuck from the room. Anyone entering to
see her or perform another test would
immediately detect his absence and
spread an alarm.
When she heard a soft jingling and saw
the side door open again she was first relieved,
then greatly alarmed.
A doctor wearing surgical greens and a
mask poked his head around the door.
When he saw only Lisa sitting on her bed,
he pulled away the mask, grinned and
waved 4 large, heavily loaded paper bags at her.



"Michael!"




“Who else? These surgical getups are great.
Nobody even asked me who I was.
Anybody show up while I was gone?"


"No. You took a chance, Michael,
sneaking out like that.”


"Not really." Michael grabbed the serving
table from the corner of the room and
wheeled it towards her bed.





"Remember Nurse Johnson said you were
to get some rest, and she sounds like the person
who would enforce an order like that.
It's midafternoon so the hospital cafeteria kitchen
is closed--I checked on the way out--and no
one was likely to suddenly arrive with food,
so the odds were good you'd be undisturbed
by any visitors for a while. Anyway I was
hungry and as I understand it my growing
girlfriend is probably starving by now.



Rumor has it she theoretically requires
2 million calories or so they say”


He added the last part with a dig at the doctors.


“Oh you! You’re something else”


“So I’ve been told”
He replies cheekily.

Chapter 19 : Mealtime


Michael quickly stripped off his disguise and
placed the bags on the table. Aimi sniffed the
aromas coming from the bags and her mouth
watered. Michael opened each bag and
presented each item to her with a flourish.


"Hamburgers, Hot Dogs, Pizza or
club sandwiches?"
he asked.


“You missed breakfast, so I figured I better bring
a double helping of each for you."


Aimi laughed--and grabbed for some grub.
She ate quickly while Michael opened a cold
2-liter bottle of soda for her and a smaller one
for himself. She ate the hamburgers in two bites,
ignoring how petite each looked. Next she ate a
couple of Hot Dogs also in 2 bites apiece.



Michael bit into a club sandwich. Aimi finished both
sets of fries and started on the untouched
club sandwich, finishing her meal in a
few minutes. Next she ate 3
slices of pizza, both soft pretzels with
cheese sauce
and bowl of cottage cheese.


“I guess you were a little more hungry
than you thought,"
he said.

Aimi grinned sheepishly.


“Hey like the doctors said and you already knew
I’m a growing girl and plus I haven’t had anything
since last nights petite dinner”


“Keep that up and you’ll be less petite”


“Are you calling me fat or a pig? You jerk”


“I’m the jerk that brought you a meal also you
ate my fries and didn’t leave me a pretzel”




“Hmmph that’s what you get for being a jerk”


“Hnn women. Give em everything and bring em
food and they still can’t show a little appreciation”



Aimi while insulted had to admit given
the circumstances and her hogging the food
and his risk taking that she
indeed could’ve shown a little more gratitude.


“Hnn well lucky for my growing
emerald eyed beauty I’m a sucker for
tall cute tomboys who have admirable
life goals”


Aimi blushed.

“It was very good. Thank you," she replied,
bending down to kiss him on the cheek.

There was a pause.

“And I’m sorry I took some of the food you wanted.
there’s still some slices of pizza,
and 1 Hot Dog left
if you want it? I call dibs on that
Tuna Salad Sandwich
and the fruit cup though”



“You’re welcome, apologies accepted,
I’ll take one of those slices of pizza and the hot dog.
The rest is yours my growing beauty”


Aimi blushed again!


“Aww my hero.” She said then kissed him again.
She then took another slice of pizza and finished it
in 3 bites.



“For hospital food this stuff isn’t that bad”
Michael added eating his hot dog as
Aimi chugged her soda.


“Sooo is Charlie still outside” she asked
starting on the last slice of pizza that
wasn’t claimed
and saving the other for Michael.


“Let me go look” he said standing up.


As he did so and as Aimi ate the pizza another
wave of vertigo hit.


“Whoa. That one was strong”


“Another spell?”

“Yea. That one felt bigger. I haven’t
noticed but
I don’t think the frequency or amount is
consistently the same every time”


“Hmm that’s interesting to know”


“So about Charlie is he still there?”


“Yes and no. Charlie is gone which is good for
him since I still kinda wanna punch him for eyeing
my girl”


Aimi blushed. Then took a bite of her
Tuna sandwich.
at her size it was really only 2 bites to finish it.


“Anyway it’s not Charlie it’s somebody else.
Looks like round-the-clock surveillance for
both of us.
I keep wondering when they're going to try
to grab me."


“Grab you?”




“Yep. There was quite a gaggle of doctors and
other folks at the end of the hall when I came
back upstairs. I couldn't get close enough to
hear what they were saying but
they were pointing
this way. From the x-rays they were
holding I suppose
they got your tests back and they're pretty
excited about them."


There was a pause and he noted their food still
left.


“Listen I think we should finish the food quickly
and then dispose of the evidence before they come
and bust us.”


Aimi nodded and chugged her fruit cup the whole
chunks of fruit seemingly not bothering her.
Michael finished his hot dog then l
ripped off a chunk of pizza.


“Here you eat it. I’m not knocking your appetite
but you’d finish this faster than I can and I hate
to waste good food”



Aimi did so. Michael gathered the trash and
pitched it in the room next door.
Just in good time too.
He returned with unpleasant news.



“I heard them from the other room. They’re getting
even more antsy over your results”


“Maybe they found a cause for my growing?"
Aimi said. Michael shrugged.


"Or, they just found a lot more questions to ask."


"Did you see Doctor Peterson at all?"


"Nope. Not a bit. I have the feeling that he might
be one of our neighbors pretty soon here, too."


Aimi looked concerned!

Chapter 20: A Promise And A Melting Heart


Aimi could not dispel a sense of
dread at Michael’s words. He was
half-turned towards the main door to the
room, his arms crossed. She saw his jaw
tighten, and his hand clench into a fist.
He exhaled gustily, then turned to face
her, his expression clear.


"Well, we'll see what happens.
Somebody should show up soon to reveal
the results of your tests."


Aimi reached out suddenly with her arms.
"Michael, please hold me," she said.


“Wha--of course," he replied.
He came within the circle of her arms and
tried to wrap his hands around her back.
Aimi tightened her grip and lifted Michael
from the floor, depositing him in her lap.
Michael was startled at first, and then he
relaxed and settled into her lap,
his head resting on her small breasts, his arms
around her. Aimi squeezed him tightly, crushing
some of the air out of him.



"What is it?" he asked, looking up into
Aimi’s face, his eyes shining, and his smile huge.


“Nothing. I-I just..”


“It’ll be ok” he tried to reassure her.


“It-it’s just even though I’m big and growing
still... I feel as helpless as I did when
I was tiny and bullied and ostracized”




“I know Aimi. I really wish I could do more for you...
For both of us. But I promise you I’ll stick with
you and if they try to take you from me I’ll fight
like hell to get you back. They have no clue
what Michael Gail is capable of, what connections
he or has or how far he’ll go to keep the best
bond with a female companion he’s ever had”


Aimi was shocked to hear that.
“Michael.. I... thank you”


“You don’t have to thank me. Just promise me
you’ll stay strong and promise me no matter what
that at the very least rather it’s lovers or friends
that we will maintain a relationship no matter what”


Aimi hesitated then nodded and kissed him.


Aimi tried smoothing his hair back with her fingers.
“You need cleaning up again."


"Afraid so--but I don't want to move from this
spot for a while."


Aimi returned his smile and kissed him on the
top of his head, one big hand rubbing his neck
and chin. Michael half-closed his eyes and
leaned into her small but budding breasts.


He began to rub her side and back.
They sat together on Aimi’s makeshift bed,
utterly contented in each other, and
Aimi was surprised to find herself totally
happy for the first time that day and the 1st time
in a long time. That wall that had built up for
so long shielding her emotions was
starting to crack.


She chuckled in her mind. It was funny how much
she reminded herself of a couple
of Anime characters.





She heard a tiny creak as the front door
opened very slowly. Out of the corner of her
eye saw Nurse Johnson's head appear in the gap.
She saw Nurse Johnson look at Michael and
herself, then withdraw and silently
close the door again.


Michael suddenly threw off his lethargy
and slid from Aimi’s lap. She woke from
the reverie she slipped into and rubbed her eyes.


"I'm sorry, did I wake you?"




"No," she replied.
“I haven't felt really sleepy since last night.
It’s like I’m a rechargeable battery turned
Energizer Battery! What's up?"



"I need to get to my car.
I've got a cellular phone and some
other things in there that should come in handy."


"Michael, you're not going to sneak out again?"


"Sure. Aimi, how do you feel about North Carolina?"


"What? You're joking."






“I've never been more serious.
I'm inviting you to come stay with me.
I think you'll like it. The weather's more
pleasant than here, and I'd love to have you."


"Michael, be serious, I can barely fit l
comfortably inside this room. Trying to
live in my own house would be an impossibility
at best! How am I supposed to fit in your house?"


"It's a pretty big house. I've got money, remember."



"What, did you build it on the scale
of Mount Olympus?"


"Well, no, but we'll make do."




"What about the hospital,
and--and me, and you?" Aimi gestured to her body,
which was straining the two gowns she wore.
Michael seemed utterly unconcerned.


"There are hospitals down there, too,"
he countered.
"I paid for one of them--My family’s paid for 2
of them and there’s even the one I 1st took you to
between here and there"


He did? Just how rich is he?
she thought for the 1st time actually curious
about his wealth. Never mind that now tho.



“— and there's some pretty good,
smart folks down there who can offer as
much help to you as these people up here."


Aimi said nothing, her mouth open.


"Please, Aimi? I want you to come with me,
to be with me. Please?"


Aimi slipped from the bed to her knees,
the impact making the floor tremble.
She flung her arms around Michael,
crushing him up to her small yet not small breasts.
She kissed him hard on the lips.


"Yes, of course I will!"


The staff on the eighth floor of
Vassar Brothers Hospital were showing
the effects of a long, strange day.
Their "amazing patient" was still quiescent
in her room, accompanied by the man she
called Michael.


Things were already interesting for
the hospital staff and yet the odd calm
hanging around failed to belay that more
excitement was yet to come!

Chapter 21 : No Fun Ride Part I



The staff on the eighth floor of
Vassar Brothers Hospital were showing the
effects of a long, strange day.
Their "amazing patient" was still quiescent in
her room, accompanied by the man she
called Michael.



The doctors were wound into a furor over
Aimi Warner’s condition which was
more vexing than her name, because
there was no cause for it. All her blood tests had
come back normal--no excessive gonadotropin or
pituitary gland secretions, no chemical
evidence of acromegaly.



Her growth was almost mathematically
perfect and proportional except her legs
were a bit longer than normal and she
was actually getting slightly thinner losing
body fat--no thickening of long bones
beyond what would be proportionate
to her growth, no excess
tissue in her hands, no broadening of her jaw.




Urine and fecal samples were also negative.
Her x-rays were the major surprise, because
there were none. Every attempt to penetrate her
body with radiation resulted in opaque films
with no useable images at all.
Save for her steadily increasing size
the one patient appeared utterly normal
and very healthy, in fact insanely so perhaps the
healthiest human to ever exist and
the male patient was not affected at all.




“Normal?" Doctor Yolanda Scott said.
Isolation Unit Nursing Supervisor Debbie Johnson
stood her ground.


"Yes. Of course, she's not normal,
because she keeps growing bigger, but
there is just no evidence whatsoever
of any disease processes at work
in her body. She's just--growing."


"I'm sorry to burst your bubble, Debbie,
but hyper-gigantism is a
disease--what the hell is this?"


Ten people erupted onto the eighth floor from
the elevator interrupted the discussion.
They were dressed in light blue anticontamination
suits that covered them from head to foot,
and carried metal cases marked prominently
with red crosses.
Scott and Johnson both left the nurse's station and approached the strangers.



One of them held up a hand as if to ward
them away and they stopped.


"Now, just who are you?" Scott asked.
“Where do you come from?"


“We’re here to see your patient
known as one Aimi Warner”
one of the figures replied, his voice tiny
and distorted by the speaker attached to his suit.



"We're from the
Centers for Disease Control in Atlanta."


"I'm well aware of where the CDC
is located, buddy," Scott retorted.


“Who gave you clearance to come up here?
This is the isolation unit."


“I did," another voice said.
Scott turned to see the elevator door open again.
This time she saw two of the administrators
of the hospital, who were accompanying
another man in uniform.


"Doctor Scott, may I present
Doctor Bartholomew Lang.
Doctor Lang is here to take
over Miz Warner’s care."




"Mr. Kimball," Scott acknowledged
the administrator, and turned her attention
to the man in uniform. To be precise, he was
dressed in the uniform of an officer of the
United States Army. He was below-medium-sized
and rail-thin, pale and unpleasant looking.
Both Scott and Johnson were stopped in
their tracks by his cold, gray eyes.
He spoke no word but tipped his uniform
cap towards them.





“In which room is the patient?" Kimball asked.
Scott pointed.


"802, right down the hall."


Lang turned and motioned to the
mass of blue-suited figures.
They moved en masse to the room Aimi occupied,
pushing aside the orderly guarding the entry.
Aimi was lying on her side in or rather
on her dual beds when
the new people entered the room.
She rose up on her elbow and gulped in
surprise, her eyes flickering briefly at the
side door Michael used to leave.




“What's going on?" she asked as the
gaggle of blue suited people surrounded her.
She started to rise out of bed.



"Please don't get up, Miz Warner,"
one of the figures spoke.


“I'm sorry if we frightened you.
We're from the Centers for Disease
Control in Atlanta, Georgia.
My name is Doctor Sadler.
We've come to examine you and take a
look at your case. Please pardon the suits
we're wearing. It's just a precaution."


Aimi had a feeling this wasn’t going
to go well at all.

Chapter 22 : No Fun Ride Part II


Aimi looked around. She noticed that half
of the gaggle was busy examining the
corners of the room rather than her.
She found she did not like the way the
others were staring at her. She had the feeling
she was more a specimen than a
patient with these newcomers.



"I understood there are two of you
here in this room," Sadler continued.


“A man called Michael?
Do you know where he is now?"


"Ah, no, I don't," Aimi replied.
"He left.


"Left?"




"Yes. He went out that door."
She gestured to the side door.
From his expression she could see
Sadler was livid, although he kept his voice steady.
She was inwardly pleased that Michael
had left when he did, as her feeling of dread
had returned a hundredfold.
She could feel her heart starting to pound
from adrenaline and fear.



"You'd better not--Miz Warner,
this is very serious. Michael
Whatever-his-name-is could be
carrying a dangerous, infectious disease.
We need to know where he is."



"I'm sorry, Doctor Sadler, but he
didn't tell me where he was going.
He said something about his car, I think."


Sadler looked around, and three of the
suited figures left. He turned back to Aimi.


"Miz Warner, we are going to transport
you to a facility which will be better for you
and your ongoing condition," he said.



"Is there anything you need?"

There was a silence.

“How did he go through the door? When?"


"He had a key. I don’t have a watch so
I can't say how long ago."




“Yes a phone. I need to get word to my
family that I’m being kidnapped by the
government.”


Her attempt at humor fell flat.
Sadler made another motion, and
two more blue-suited figures appeared,
each carrying a small canister.
Aimi reacted immediately but the gas released
from the canisters touched her skin before
she could get to her feet. She collapsed back
onto the bed.





Her limbs and body suddenly felt like they
had become ten times heavier.
She tried to cry out but couldn't get her
mouth to do more than croak.
She watched as a large gurney was
wheeled into the room.
Atop the gurney was an opaque rectangular
plastic bag, punctured with holes at regular
intervals. The people around her opened the bag
and began to push her body into it.


Aimi was horrified at being shoved
into what looked like an oversized
body bag and tried to thrash at the
hands pulling at her.
She made contact with one of the figures,
flinging him across the room and
shattering his faceplate, but more gas was
sprayed on her, and she went
completely limp. She began to cry as her
body was squeezed into the bag and
its opening was zippered shut.






Nurse Johnson was among the group of
physicians standing around the nurse's station,
watching the procession of blue-suited
figures go by, surrounding a gurney bearing
an isolation unit logo. A high, hissing voice caught
her attention, and she turned slightly to see the l
Army officer, Lang, on a portable telephone




"I don't give a fat rat's ass,
dammit--I want that facility operational now.
I am tired of your excuses!
What the hell does that mean?
Are you telling me the Air Force shuts
down on the weekends?
Damn right you will get the doors open
for our cargo. What? Don’t give me
forty-eight hours--you've got eight
hours to get it up and running. Don't mess
with me, you won't like it.
Okay, fine-- 14 hours but that’s it, and it damned
well better open up as advertised."


He angrily hung up.


A squeaking noise called her attention
back to the parade of figures walking
towards the freight elevators.
She could make out an
outline of knees--big knees belonging
to long legs--bent double inside the bag
on the stretcher. She shook her head and
looked at the eyes of the other staff members.




Most looked relieved that Aimi was
gone, but a few looked sad,
concerned and frightened.
Johnson looked closer at one of
the sets of eyes. There were brown,
intense--and unfamiliar.
The owner of those eyes noticed
her inspection and turned away,
walking down the hall towards the
stairs, his stethoscope bouncing around
his neck. Johnson followed.
He stepped through the door leading
to the stairwell with Johnson one step behind.




She was one step into the stairwell
when a hand grabbed her arm and
dragged her into a corner.
Michael leaned towards her until his
masked face was only inches from her own.



"Where are they taking her?" he said.
Johnson, shocked by her bouncing off
the wall, did not answer, and was shaken
like a small child by two powerful hands.



"Where are they taking her?"
Michael demanded again.


"I don't know," Johnson replied.

Chapter 22 : No Fun Ride Part III




"I don't know," Johnson replied.



"Look, I'm sorry what's happened,
Michael--was it?"
He nodded and released the
nursing supervisor.
She rocked on her feet for a moment,
then steadied.



"I'm sorry for the rough handling,
and I'm grateful to you for the kindness
you showed Aimi," he said.



“Now, who the hell are those people?"



"They said they're from the
Centers for Disease Control."



"You don't really believe that?"




"No. The guy in charge is military.
I think they all are.
They have a brutish lack
of decorum and bedside manner
and on top of that
disrespect towards they deem beneath them”



"Did you get his name?"



"I--yes, I did. Lang. Bartholomew Lang.
He's U.S. Army."



Michael stood for a second, considering.
He reached out and took Johnson's hand.



"Thank you again."


He shocked her more by slipping her
3 $100 dollar bills, A 20 and a 5.




"Wait, Michael," Johnson called after him
as he began to go down the stairs.



"This is serious. They're going to be
looking for you. Aimi’s sick of something--"



“Fuck them! To hell with them! Aimi might be
sick but she’s not contagious and she’s not a
damn lab rat for the army or anyone else.
I’m getting her back no matter what.
Thanks again for your help”



Johnson left the stairwell and returned
to the group of hospital staff milling
around the desk. They were watching
the blue-suited people hose down the hallway,
Aimi’s room and each other with tanks of
disinfectant spray.
No one else in the group noticed that
Johnson began to smile.


Johnson had a feeling about those two!

’ Well Michael right or wrong I hope
you give those suits hell. The nerve of them
man handling my patient and barging in here!
I don’t take kindly to pricks who are full
of themselves just because they have
authority and power over others being
condescending!


I hope those military asshats get their
comeuppance!
I also hope that boy knows what sort
of relationship he’s getting into!
They say love is a battlefield but with a
girl like that it might be pretty one sided
if it weren’t for her being mostly the gentle
sort!

Chapter 23 : Kidnapped Again Part I


Poughkeepsie, New York
Sometime on Sunday-


The utter blackness inside the sack was
overwhelming. Aimi struggled against
the paralyzing effects of the gas she had
been sprayed with, trying to raise her arms
or kick with her legs. She was suddenly
pinned down by bands across her chest
and thighs. The restriction cut off what little
air she was able to draw. She tried to cry
out but her vocal cords wouldn't cooperate.






She felt herself begin to move, rapidly
and violently, swinging first to one side,
then another. She then jolted to a stop.
She heard elevator doors close.



“Whew," a voice said. "Jesus, what a job."



“Can it, boys," a female voice snapped.



"Man, is she strong," another male voice said.
“Did you see Cox? She tossed him fifteen
feet and busted his suit. They're going to
have to bag him, too."


Aimi closed her eyes and forced
herself to relax, concentrating on
her breathing. A tiny amoun
of fresh air, probably from one of those filters
near her head, was coming into the bag.
Feeling was returning to her limbs
but cramping and queasiness put in an
appearance in her midsection.
She inhaled more deeply, a moan escaping her.




"Shit, she's still awake!
Somebody trank her, right now!"
the first male voice said.



Aimi felt something pierce her leg.



“Trank in," the female voice said.
Aimi felt weakness spreading around
the prick in her leg. She whimpered
in pain and an increasing fury, and began
to strain her arms against the bonds that
held her to the stretcher. She felt something
give, and she was injected with another dose,
then another.


The new drug made her violently nauseous
and she turned her head just in time.
Her vomit fouled the space around her
head and choked her. The voices outside
the bag rose into a loud,
incomprehensible babble, and another
restraint was applied across her top.



Aimi ceased moving to ease the cramping
and nausea in her middle, not hearing the
collective sigh of relief as
she appeared quiescent.



Aimi felt cold touch her everywhere.
She must be outside. She heard the
beeping of a car horn, then a loud rattling
of metal. She thought she heard a faint
voice call out her name as she went up
an incline and into a hollow-sounding box.
More voices appeared and she heard a car
or truck engine start.



The cramping in her
belly grew greater and Aimi struggled
with the pain.
She closed her eyes and tried to ignore how
her own vomit was soaking into her hair,
wishing she would really fall unconscious
so she wouldn't hear and feel what was
happening to her.


It was an awful horrible experience.





Michael watched with impotent rage
as a gaggle of suited people hurried
Aimi into the back of a truck. He pounded
his fist against the cold brickwork of the
hospital wall.


"Aimi!" he shouted, then restrained himself.
What these people were doing to her
was totally wrong.
She wasn't a danger to anybody.
She didn't need or deserve to be treated this way


’Ever hear of asking, motherfuckers?!.
Two hundred fifty million Americans and
the only ones we meet are all assholes.
Also she’s still a damn minor.
They best believe their asses are gonna be tied
up in court for years after I get Aimi back
and they get demoted or sacked!




Michael was seething but rage wouldn’t help
Aimi at least not unless he put it to use.
He made himself turn away and goaded
his brain into activity. A new commotion in
the hospital parking lot caught his eye.
Another group of suited people were
climbing all over a few cars
then they got to his.




He squinted to see against the blinding
sun and realized they were pulling everything
from the cars and placing each
item from them in plastic bags.


He overheard a few of them.


“This Michael Person is annoying.
I can’t believe we had to run the license plates
on every damned car here and there’s
4 people named Michael”





Suddenly the hospital PA switched on and the
2nd suit guy could be heard.


“Well what do you expect with an incompetent
hospital staff of idiots in a back woods town”


Several staff and patients glared dagger eyes
at the suits.


“Crap what the hell?
Damn it 1 of those weasels slipped
a mic into 1 of our containment bags!
These backwards back woods idiots
are gonna pay”


“Kline shut up that mic is still hot and
people are glaring”


"Serious bastards, aren't you," he muttered
under his breath. Michael was amused at that
prank though. Serves these guys right.
Somebody was watching us from the start.
He felt the hair rise on the back of his
neck and whipped around.


"Looking for me, are we?" he whispered.
He counted 9 men dressed in business
suits and coats in the lobby of the hospital.




Michael sauntered from the parking area,
walking down the sidewalk past the front
lobby, openly looking at the group of men.
One had what looked like a crude drawing
in his hand. They turned to look at him,
then looked away, none making any
move towards the doors.

Chapter 24 : Kidnapped Again Part II


Michael continued until he was
around the corner. He kept walking,
aiming for the pay phone down the block.


"They hire 'em smart, that's for sure,"
he muttered as he grabbed the receiver
from its cradle with one hand while with the
other he dug into a pocket, retrieving a small
piece of paper. He plunked in two
quarters and was rewarded with a dial tone.


"Express Taxi Service."


"I'd like a cab, please. I'm at the corner
of South Avenue and Reade Place, going
to the Westchester County Airport."


"Five minutes."



“Make it 3 and I’ll pay you folks quadruple rate
and some change”



“You bet mister”



"Thank you."


The dial tone came back.


During his wait he noticed the lazier and
less bright
of the G-Men looking at stuff on his iPad
including internet crap


|￣￣￣￣￣￣￣￣￣￣￣|
NO
THEY DON'T
|＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿＿|
(\__/) ||
(•ㅅ•) ||
/ 　 づ

He had to admit it was amusing yet
unprofessional.


Again he thought mockingly towards them.





Michael replaced the receiver and looked at
his watch. Four p.m. He sensed danger again
and looked around. Two of the men he
had seen in the hospital lobby had rounded
the corner and were casually
walking in his direction.


’ You people have half a brain after all,
he thought


He turned away and walked briskly until
he was near the corner. He looked back.
The men were walking fast, directly for him.
Michael jumped on to Lincoln Avenue,
dodging honking, screeching cars and
complaining drivers. The men tried to
follow but were impeded by the maze of
cars created by his precipitous appearance
in the road.


Michael reached the opposite
sidewalk and ran headlong into the lobby
of the nearest building. He moved as quickly
as possible, still holding his phone and suitcase,
dashing through into an open hallway.



As expected it was a professional office,
with a lobby entrance on either side of the
building. Michael ran headlong onto
South Street, pausing to whip his belt
out of his pants. He threaded the belt
through the lobby door handles and tugged
the ends into a knot, then turned and walked
slowly towards Reade Place. As he reached
the corner, a taxi arrived.




Michael stepped in quickly and the driver
accelerated away. He looked through
the rear windscreen. No one was behind him.
He blew his cheeks out and
swallowed to moisten
his mouth and throat, then dug into his
coat pocket and tapped on the wire grill
separating the passenger compartment
from the driver.


“My friend," he said,
"I've got $2,000 extra dollars cash
with your name on it. It's yours if you
can get me to the Westchester County
airport in thirty minutes."



The taxi driver looked back.
His eyes lit up at the sight of the
cash in Michael's hand.


"Man, you're crazy. It's rush hour!
Okay, I'm on my way."


As the cab sped off Michael began furiously
dialing call after Call glad he had his portable
charger on him.




- Unknown Location -


Aimi was shivering, claustrophobic and
starving for air when she felt the truck she l
was in roll up a steep incline and come
to a stop. The door rolled open.
Her ears were assaulted by the howl of
jet engines very close by, accompanied
by shouting. The sounds reached a crescendo,
then dimmed, and she felt the bag around
her head being tugged and pulled.





The restraints disappeared and light
suddenly flooded into the bag, dazzling her.
Hands reached into the bag, grabbed her
shoulders and began to pull her out of its
confinement, tearing gaps in the hospital gown
covering her front.



Aimi looked around as best she could
in her drugged state. She was being
drawn onto another stretcher, one with a
clear plastic envelope punctured by
more glove holes, supported by
an aluminum frame. Something poked her
in the back and she squirmed.



More hands reached into the glove holes
and help pull her into the container.
She felt her head press up against the
plastic at the head of the stretcher.


“Holy--" a voice she had heard earlier said.
"She's too big for the isolation stretcher."


"Here, help me lift her legs.
You guys up there lift her head."



By way of much pulling and pushing
Aimi was shoehorned into the new
container and heard it being sealed closed.
A soft hiss caught her attention.
Oxygen, being pumped into the envelope.
She inhaled slowly, tasting the sweet, dry air.
A gloved hand brought a plastic bottle to her lips.



“Here you go, soldier," a new voice said softly.
“Looks like you had an accident.
Have a little water. It's just water, that's all.
Good. Swallow some, it'll help clean
your mouth out."




Aimi took a little water, gagged,
and drank some more.
She looked more closely at the
source of the voice. He was middle-aged,
heavyset, and bespectacled. On the sleeve of his camouflage-pattern uniform was four
wavy stripes meeting at a
blue star symbol--some sort of sergeant,
she thought. She tried to smile in
gratitude but her mouth was barely able to work.



“That's good, Missy," he said.
“Now, you just try to relax.
Now don't be alarmed.
We just want to measure you, okay?"




Five more uniformed people suddenly
surrounded her, thrusting their hands
into the gloves. Cloth tapes and large
wooden calipers appeared in her field
of view--that must have been what had stuck
her in the back as she was put inside
the thing--and they began to measure her.



Aimi looked down at herself. God,
she was half naked--the gown she
had been using for a crude skirt had
apparently gone with the bag they had
pulled her from--and so big.
Her shoulders and hips brushed against the
plastic envelope encasing her.





She tried to lift her head to see lower across
her exposed chest and down further
but could only make out her knees touching
the top of the envelope.



"Knee to heel, seventy one centimeters,"
a voice called.


"Hip to shoulder, one hundred sixteen centimeters."


"Knee to hip, fifty five centimeters."


"Shoulder to crown, thirty six centimeters."


"Jesus, she’s over 10 feet tall!"
the familiar voice said.

Chapter 24 : Lab Rat Part I


Aimi turned to see one of the men
who had taken her from the hospital,
now out of his anticontamination suit.
He was young, with close-cropped hair
and blue eyes. He leaned over her
envelope and gave her a practiced smile.


Aimi found herself desperately
wishing she had some covering on her body.
He reached into one of the glove holes
and stroked her shoulder.
The friendly sergeant watched silently.


“There now-- Aimi, isn't it?
That wasn't so bad.
If you hadn't struggled we wouldn't
have had to trank you so much."


Aimi managed to lift her arm in an
effort to try to brush his hand away.
His hand slipped down from her
shoulder to touch her budding breasts.
His smile broadened.


“Hmm not much there but I still like it.
You’re a wild cat huh?”


Aimi looked at the sergeant.
His expression was blank but his eyes
were hard. Smiley's hand slipped from
her arm to her breast again.


"Now, you want to be a good girl
AAAUUGGGHHH!"
Aimi put all her focus on her hand.
She reached out quickly and clamped
down on his wrist, squeezing with all the
strength she had. She felt something break,
squeezed harder, then let go.


Smiley yanked his arm out of the glove hole,
stumbling backwards, grabbing at his arm.


"JESUS FUCKING CHRIST SHE
BROKE MY ARM GOD IT HURTS!"
he cried, staggering away from her stretcher.



She heard his cries suddenly cut off.
The other sergeant snickered silently knowing
his hormone driven comrade had been asking
for it.


A voice interrupted.
"Trank her," the female voice ordered.
"Goddamn it, trank her, now!"



"She reacted badly to the
last dose, Lieutenant," the friendly sergeant said.
“And plus Dobson was asking for it”


“Don't let me tell you again, Air Force dogs,"
the female voice grated.


“Knock her out. It took 30cc's of thorazine before.
This time go for 40cc’s."



An animal like fear gripped Aimi as she
saw the sergeant turn back towards her,
reaching a glove towards a metal box
hanging from the stretcher frame.
She instinctively tried to find purchase
for her elbows to push herself away from
the intruding hand, but it was
useless--she already filled the isolation
stretcher to capacity.


The sergeant pulled out a preloaded
syringe from the box and flicked off the
needle's protective cap.
Aimi reached out and touched his hand, gently.



“No…please," she whispered.
The sergeant--she had recovered
from the effects of the drug sufficiently to
read the name WALLACE on his
uniform--leaned closer to her and looked
at her face intently. He looked over his shoulder,
then at Aimi again.


“Fuck this," he growled.
He stabbed the needle into the stretcher
padding and pressed the plunger, then
carefully maneuvered the empty syringe
into a waste
bag taped to the wall of the container.





“40 cc’s of thorazine," he breathed.
"Missy, you certainly are unusual.
That was a dose a grizzly bear wouldn't
have survived. Okay, now you've got to
cooperate with me.
No more trouble--even though that
Army puke deserved it--and I promise
I'll do everything I can to make you comfortable.
Now, listen to me. That guy wasn't armed,
but three of the others are, and
they look like they want to use their guns.
You understand? Okay?"



Aimi nodded and gripped his hand.


"Good," Wallace said softly.
"First, let's get a cover over this thing
so you're not on display. Okay?"



“Thank you," Aimi croaked. Wallace smiled.
"I hope my daughter is as pretty as you when
she grows up--though I wouldn't want her to
grow up as much as you, no offense,"
Wallace said.



He grabbed a sheet and draped
it over the plastic coffin, shielding her from view.



Aimi allowed herself one deep breath.
She felt an excess of moisture forming
in her eyes as the emotional rollercoaster
she had experienced for the last day began
to overtake her, her hands shaking from the
combination of fear, adrenaline and drugs.



’Michael I'm so scared right now,
so scared. I wish you were here to hold
my hand. I need you to make me laugh
and forget that I'm trapped inside this thing,
surrounded by people who want to hurt me.
I need you to make me forget I'm the
biggest girl, the biggest person
alive--and I'm still getting bigger--
This horrible curse’


A man's thin, sallow face suddenly
thrust itself into her field of vision.
Aimi nearly screamed with fright at his hard
gray eyes and bitter features.
A nameplate attached to his
jacket read B. LANG.



"You hurt one of my men," he said,
his high, scratchy voice sending shivers
down her spine.
He leaned closer to her, until his nose touched
the plastic. "I will remember that."



Colonel Bartholomew Lang strode
into the passenger section of the C-141 Starlifter
and made his way to the communications
station. The communications operator
handed him a printout. Lang accepted
it and left the space without a word.





In the cargo bay he paused, and
allowed a satisfied look to appear on
his face. So far the operation was a success,
vindicating the endless hours spent arguing
with Pentagon lickspittles for the creation of
the Domestic Action Response Team.
He looked at his watch. Just three hours
from the moment word arrived of an
incident to implementing a
Paradigm Cordon to intern its cause.



From the idiot doctor in Middleburgh to this
oversized amazonion brat in the isolation
stretcher every possible source of
danger had been contained, save one.

Chapter 25 : Lab Rat Part II


His original orders, however, were
another matter.
Professor Turner wanted a crack at the
amazon subject and Lang had
been required to accommodate him.
Doctors and scientists always
want to analyze, to pick apart everything,
Lang thought.


They conveniently forget that
isolation and cauterization are the best ways
to kill any danger before it spreads, rather
affecting one single body or an entire population.


There was also that crime ring that had a mad
doctor in their ranks that had reached out to
him. They were vague about why they
wanted the giant brat but their bribe was a
generous one.
Still another pack of fools!
Sure making a little side profit never hurt
but the giant bitch had hurt a few good soldiers
already.


She was a threat and one that should be
put down fast as possible.
The question was how to eliminate her and
make himself look like the hero and still get paid.





To make things worse, the last subject,
a man called Michael who had stayed
with the amazon, had managed to slip from
them. Well, that wouldn't last long. Lang felt
confident that he would soon be
ridding himself--and Earth--of this
dangerous creature.




Lang opened the paper he carried
and read the message. His face drained
of what little color it had and his mouth
tightened.



“Michael" had reached the Westchester County
airport and had taken off in a private plane
without filing a flight plan or getting
clearance, then disappeared off the
airport control radars ten minutes after
takeoff. It was believed he may have
crashed in the Hudson river or somewhere
west of the airport.
Efforts to learn his identity were a failure.



Even his airplane's markings matched
nothing in the FAA databases and an
examination of the EAA records had so far been unsuccessful.


That bastard seemed slippery and resourceful.
Plans could’ve been going better for him but
Lang was resourceful too.




For the first time since
the Paradigm Cordon began,
Lang felt a real sense of concern.
People and aircraft were registered
somewhere.
Had to be--unless, of course, they
weren't native to the planet.



He was sure that wasn’t the case though!



He could see the chief medical officer,
Captain Davenport, and
Sergeant Wallace conferring quietly
beside the head of the isolation stretcher.
Wallace had one hand inside a glove hole.
He was holding the bitch's
hand--fucking Air Force wimp.
According to the witnesses interviewed
prior to internment this "Michael"
was her constant companion.


Was he a willing companion,
or something else?
Lang had a feeling this "Michael"
would be difficult.
Very well--Lang could be difficult, too.


If only Lang knew what was coming his way.


- A Private Runway in the countryside-



“You heard me I want every available resource
searching for a female patient abducted from
Vassar. Additionally start putting together a legal
team for a case that may need to go to the higest of
courts. Aimi Warner is someone important to me
and not only have her rights been potentially
violated but she’s a minor to boot.


Also keep trying to contact her sister slash
mentor slash guardian Sasha the infamous
detective slash crime fighter.



I want to launch both criminal, civil and
civil rights complaints and legal action on her
behalf. Also if necessary we may need to
track down her other relatives.
She’s already lost her mom and dad and
now this she doesn’t need more tragedies
or traumatic experiences in her life”




“Yes as you wish and most generous of you
to offer 10x the normal rates for all services
rendered. We will absolutely make your requests
top priority even if thru questionable means.
We are grateful that you also kept our burn
phone and will do our best to keep things
legal or at least without a body count.


Incidentally we also have no problems
with you outsourcing this job to multiple
groups and firms. You are after all a good client
and have paid your protection money
more promptly than any of the others.
On that note you’ll be happy to know that
all the places you have us protecting the locals
are still doing well.





If I may be so bold Mister Porter you seem
quite fond of this girl.
We have no intention to leverage her against
you in fact as the boss and a wooer of women
myself I wish you and your new gal luck
once we recover her for you”




“Thanks and give my regards to the misses
and the kids and tell your men I hope they’ve
found the bonus I included with my cash payment
both useful and EZ to use”


He hung up the phone.

“Are you sure about this Michael
Getting deeper in bed with criminals?
Your mother would disapprove of you turning
into your fathers old occasional bad habits to
put it nicely”


“I have little choice Punjab!
I have to use as many resources as I can.
This Lang. He’s hard to track down, apparently well
connected as are those around him.
Even rich as I am going against a government
or a rogue element within it isn’t an EZ task.
Besides I ordered limited or zero casualties
for a reason unless they deserve it or are an
obstruction plus using a few criminals could
protect us provided we play our cards right”



-sigh-
“Of course sir! How noble of you sir

Chapter 26 : Lab Rat Part III




-Unknown Location
Sometime Sunday Evening-


It seemed her bad dream would
never end. Aimi could feel the first real
vestiges of claustrophobia pulling at her as she
contorted herself in the dwindling space
of the isolation stretcher. Wallace tried to
make her as comfortable as possible but his
efforts were undone by her inflating body.






The tough plastic of the isolation stretcher
was being warped by her knees, feet and
head. Her hospital gown had torn in every
possible strategic place, leaving her
essentially naked.



She felt her chest first brushing,
then pressing against the container with
every breath she took.
Her chin was crowding her collarbone
and her calves and shins ached from the
contortions of her feet. She tried wrapping
her arms under her budding breasts to make
more room in the coffin but hands on one
end of her forearms and elbows on the
other pressed into the plastic too tightly
for comfort. Two additional efforts to measure
her body showed she was still growing at
an unpredictable--and incredibly fast--pace.






Despite the flood of oxygen coming
into the stretcher the air was becoming
increasingly foul--she was using it up
faster than it could be pumped in.
Efforts by Wallace and Davenport
to raise her upper back to allow her
more room only helped for a short while.



Aimi began to get angry and hysterical.
If this insanity didn't stop soon she would
have no choice but to force her way out,
the integrity of the stretcher be damned
and notwithstanding her promise to
Wallace not to be resistant to her captors.



Captors. The word both infuriated and
frightened her.


’I got a news flash for you people:
I didn't ASK for this to happen!’



They were treating her like
some dangerously virulent disease.
She thought again of
Michael --his smile, his ready
acceptance of her increasing size,
his enthusiasm and optimism, and
his solemn promise to her.



’God, Michael , I miss you. I wish I could
feel your hands around--on me--right now.
I wish I could see your eyes and your smile.
I wish I knew why you made me feel this way?
I wish you were here!



Aimi turned her head as much as she could
to one side. She could see the thin form
of the man named Lang, surrounded by
three others armed with assault rifles.




’But please don't let Lang get his grubby
hands on you. I don't think he wants
either of us alive. He’s an annoyance!’



Aimi resisted the urge to scream for
release--Wallace had repeatedly told
Lang's people that she was tranquilized
to the max and any outburst would make
him a liar and her a threat. She closed her
eyes, trying to imagine that
Michael was sitting beside her, holding her hand--



“Aimi” Wallace called softly.
She snapped her eyes open.
She saw that Wallace was eyeing the
bumps her body was making in
the isolation stretcher.


"Uh, we're going to be landing in a
few minutes," he continued.


"Where?"



"I'm sorry, I can't tell you.
We've been ordered not to.
But I know where we're going, and I
think it's going to be okay for you.
It's a top-flight medical facility, fully equipped.
The doctors there are some of the
best in the world.
If anybody can find a way to stop you
growing, they can."





Wallace's enthusiasm was a bit forced,
Aimi thought, but anything would be
better than this constricting plastic
coffin she inhabited.



-elsewhere-


“Mister Grail we may have a lead on where
they took Miss Warner. The informant however
wants further measures of secrecy taken, a larger
payoff, and greater guarantee should things go
south.

Chapter 27 : Lab Rat Part IV



The stretcher began a jolting ride
across the tarmac. Aimi observed her
surroundings as best she could.
It was clearly a military airport, or base, judging
from the nearby airplanes
Wherever she was, it was still near
or at sundown.
It was also very warm-- Aimi felt herself
perspiring freely in her constricting
enclosure moments after leaving the
coolness of the aircraft cargo bay.






She was grateful that Wallace had tied down
the sheet over the stretcher so that she wasn't
visible to passersby but it limited her vision.
She grit her teeth as the motion made
her contorted body ache even more.


Aimi was thrust into a building.
She rolled down a short corridor dimly
lit by ultraviolet lamps, then came to
a stop. A door loudly opened, then her
head was thrust into a small, square opening.
She saw hands sealing her isolation
stretcher to the rim of the opening.
Another metal thump immediately
above her head made her jump.
She felt the plastic over her head
come loose and she stretched herself into
the new space. It felt good.
Then the point of her shoulders
butted against the hard metal rim of a hatch.



Aimi tilted her head up and saw a
crowd of people dressed in
more anti-contamination suits--silver colored
and with larger faceplates this time--hovering
at the other side of the hatch.
The nearest was a woman with oriental
features who was in the act of reaching
out to her.
When Aimi moved she jerked her hands back.





“She's too big to fit in the hatch,"
Aimi heard her say.



“Well, do the best you can,"
a man's voice replied.
Hands reached in and grasped
her armpits and began to tug.
It was both ineffective and painful.



“Hey!" Aimi yelled. "That hurts! Perverts!"



“I thought she was tranquilized,"
the male voice said again.


Aimi felt the anger she had bottled
up inside her begin to surface, and she
fought to contain it.


"If you want me inside, ask," she snapped
at the new gaggle of people.



She carefully raised one arm
through the hatch.
Finding a grip around the hatch rim,
she pulled herself through the opening to
her shoulders. With both hands available
she now shoved herself into the room.
She twisted her hips and leaned until her
fingers found the floor.
Squirming her body and legs, she was
able to force her way into her new
enclosure, the hatch closing after her.



Aimi breathed deeply and stretched
in sheer ecstasy at actually being able
to move after so long. She opened her
eyes and counted twelve people encircling
her. She was almost as tall sitting down as
the tallest of them standing up.
Her joints throbbed as she drew her legs
underneath her, then slowly stood erect.
As one her newest audience all took a full
step backward as she reached her full height,
some pushing past their neighbors behind them.


One man's legs buckled beneath him and
he crashed to the floor in a heap.


She groaned as circulation returned to
her legs and buttocks and she twisted
from side to side.



Then she remembered the state she was in.
The remnants of her gown fluttered from
around her neck like streamers nearly to her
waist, covering nothing.
She felt herself flush, and sighed.



"Thank you for letting me out of that thing,"
she said politely.
"Now, if you don't mind,
I'd like to know where I am."



One of the suited figures moved
suddenly, forcing his way to the front.


"I'm Doctor William Turner," he said,
his voice distorted by his suit microphone.



“Your name is Aimi Marie Warner?
You see miss Warner, I received a very
unusual phone call from
a Doctor John Peterson early one morning.
He told me one of his adolescent patients
with a history of stunted growth was suddenly
growing at an incredible if not alarming rate
of speed.”




He paused. Aimi was miffed at the reminder of
her former height misfortune still not use to
not being short.



“And You can imagine that I did not
believe him until I got another call from
a hospital in upstate New York--"


“Vassar Brothers,"
another figure said helpfully.
Turner nodded, looking annoyed at
being interrupted.




“Yes, that was it. Well, they told me that
they had an adolescent female who grew
visibly bigger during her stay there.
Now, there is no record of any human being
who suffered such a sudden growth in
all medical history. In fact, just the caloric
requirements alone--"





“Doctor," Aimi interrupted,
"I have already been told why
what's happening to me shouldn't be
happening. I have also been drugged,
gassed, kidnapped, stuffed into suffocating
body bags and threatened."
She gestured to the three bruises on
her thigh from the drug injections,
then pointed to the hatch.



“Now, I would like to know where I am
and what I am doing here."


Turner wrung his hands together, then stopped.





"Miss Warner, I do not know the exact
means used to bring you here.
Please accept my apologies for any
ill-treatment you may have received.
The reason you are here is because what's
happening to you is so unusual that a potential
threat to the public health exists.
It was decided to bring you to a facility
where you can get the very best treatment
while protecting the public at the same time."


Aimi’s bullshit detector was going off
but she played along.
She had a distinct feeling that a few of
the creeps in this place including
“the good doctor” couldn’t be trusted.
